matrixes.name: Survival Matrix
matrixes.description: The drive to meet basic needs and feel secure, often leading to fear-based decisions and scarcity mindset.

matrixes.name: Status Matrix
matrixes.description: The need to feel worthy through comparison, achievement, or validation from others.

matrixes.name: Logic Matrix
matrixes.description: The belief that intellect and structure alone can solve life and avoid vulnerability.

matrixes.name: Emotion Matrix
matrixes.description: The tendency to be overwhelmed or defined by emotions, attachment, and relational drama.

matrixes.name: Pleasure Matrix
matrixes.description: The escape into stimulation, indulgence, or dopamine-seeking to avoid discomfort.

matrixes.name: Independence Matrix
matrixes.description: The illusion of self-sufficiency and rejection of vulnerability, community, or trust.

matrixes.name: Purpose Matrix
matrixes.description: The identification with mission or meaning as a way to feel worthy, often with martyrdom or over-control.

definition: The 7 Matrixes are psycho-spiritual dimensions that represent illusions or identity traps modern individuals unconsciously live inside. Escaping the Matrix means awakening to a state of wholeness where action flows from presence, not programming.
